channel.title: Posts on directory
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on directory

item.title: Adding my silly utils to Github Pages
item.description: I wanted to try a dumb and quick way to just draft up some silly util functions to speed up some mundane debugging I always do at my work. Use case is as-such: 1. I have a very fat JSON value 2. It’s fat. One single X object can have about 40-ish key-values. 3. It usually has an array of X objects, and I’m only interested in one key-value. Very corner use-case, but I just wanted something blunt and silly to work with.

item.title: using hatch for application development
item.description: A barebones exploration of the use of hatch, for the use of development of a simple Python application. Using this post as a form of reference or self-help link for python project set-up. Or, you can skip the step-by-step tedious explanation by jumping to the full pyproject.toml file. Creating a new project hatch new simple-app It creates the project with the following project structure: simple_app â”œâ”€â”€ src â”‚ â””â”€â”€ simple_app â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ __about__.
